Key Match Events: Corbin Carroll hit a go-ahead grand slam in the eighth inning.
Carroll hit two home runs in the game.
Eduardo Rodriguez cruised through the first four innings without allowing a baserunner.
The Mets stormed back to score four runs in the fifth and another in the sixth to go up 5-4.
Lourdes Gurriel Jr. led off the eighth inning with a walk, followed by back-to-back walks from Pavin Smith and Geraldo Perdomo to load the bases.
Post-Match Reflections: Corbin Carroll stated he is not trying to be the hero but just trying to help the team win every day.
D-backs manager Torey Lovullo mentioned the team was battling frustration in the middle innings.
Mets center fielder Brandon Nimmo acknowledged Carroll's performance and noted his home runs were no-doubters.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The D-backs have a 35-14 record since July 1, the best in the Majors in that span.
The D-backs' 21 wins and +64 run differential since July 29 lead all of baseball.
